Complex situation? Split it into multiple conversations on different days:

2. ‚ÄúShare your side, and endeavor to build mutual understanding.‚Äù [See if you can get them to hear you.]

Don‚Äôt lead conversations with a subjective interpretation that the other person doesn‚Äôt share. Otherwise, they‚Äôll start to defend themselves and it won‚Äôt be productive. Or people will be confused if you start with a diatribe or an interpretation. Start rants with an observation.

You have emotions, and each emotion has a ‚Äútone.‚Äù Your nefesh habahames feels emotions.

Decouple from these emotions and focus on the tone, without letting it sweep you away. You are/have a nefesh elokis. Feel these emotions, but you must control your nefesh habahames, not the other way around.

Harness it.

And my addition: you can also harness the ‚Äúanimal soul‚Äù of others. If the can‚Äôt control their animal soul, then it controls them. But then you (or someone else) can control it, and use it to control them. Examples range from having sex while in the heat of the moment to impulse buys to angrily saying things people didn‚Äôt mean.
Notice and silently label your feelings over the course of the day. The more you do this, the more feeling‚Äôs you will come to recognize, and the more feelings you Will come to have.
On restating what someone said, make sure to phrase it as a question, or follow the restatement with an inquiry.

State needs in the positive rather than negative. Restate it as what someone longs for.

Instead of ‚ÄúI hear how much you dislike getting mixed messages, huh?‚Äù try, ‚ÄúI hear you want clarity and directness, knowing you can take what‚Äôs said at face value.‚Äù

Remove the word ‚Äúneed‚Äù

‚ÄúDo you need more respect?‚Äù -> ‚ÄúIt sounds like you really value respect. You were wanting more respect, right?‚Äú
State needs in the positive, rather than the negative. When stated in the negative, they often tend to evoke/imply a sense of blame. In the positive, it‚Äôs often more colloquial
In a conflict, listen for needs. This basically gives you a window into the other‚Äôs world.
